    <!-- Start Doc Content --> 
    <a name="ErrorsByNumber"> </a> 
    <h1>Errors by Number</h1> 
    <a class="navhighlight" value="Errors by Number"> </a> 
    <a class="navhighlight" value="API Reference"> </a> 
    <p>See also <a href="errorsbycall.html">Top Error Codes Returned per Call</a>.</p> 
    <p>The table below lists all of the error messages that could be encountered using the eBay Platform API. The same list of errors is applicable regardless of whether you are using the XML API, SOAP API, eBay SDK for Java, or eBay SDK for Windows.</p> 
    <p>The version number at the bottom of this topic indicates the eBay Platform API version that was in effect when this table was last generated. The number may be higher than the version of the WSDL you are using. This is because the list of possible errors can change periodically even though the WSDL may not change (due to changes in validation rules on the eBay site).</p> 
    <p>The information for each error includes: error code, error severity, short error string, and long error string. All error messages are supplied only in English, but the error codes can be used as an index for a structure, array, or string table to supply messages in whatever language is desired. Base error code translations on the error strings in this table. The type column in the error table indicates whether a message is serious error or a warning.</p> 
    <p>The string "<i>replaceable_value</i>" appears in a number of error strings. This is a placeholder where an actual value is returned in the error string at run-time. Depending on the context of the error, this replaceable value could be the name of an API tag, a user ID, an item ID, or some other string that is not known until run-time.</p> 
    <p>Errors are divided into two types, <b>System Error</b> and <b> Request Error</b>. This error type is indicated in error result sets by the value returned in the <b>ErrorClass</b> return field. The error type indicates what sort of action the application, the developer, or the end-user needs to take in response to the error.</p> 
    <p><b>Error 10007</b> ("Internal error to the application") indicates an error on the eBay server side, not an error in your application.</p> 
    <p>Most eBay errors associated with the Item Specifics (Attributes) API and Pre-filled Item Information are in these error code ranges: 912-917, 924-925, 5000-5130, 12003-12038. See <a href="http://developer.ebay.com/DevZone/guides/ebayfeatures/Development/ItemSpecifics.html">Item Specifics</a> in the eBay Features Guide for related information.</p> 
    <table border="1"> 
     <tbody>
      <tr> 
       <th>Error<br>number</th> 
       <th width="80">Severity</th> 
       <th>Description</th> 
      </tr>

       <td><a name="2"></a>2</td> 
       <td>Serious Error</td> 
       <td>Short error: Unsupported API call. <span class="longerr">Long error: The API call "<i>replaceable_value</i>" is invalid or not supported in this release.</span> </td> 
      </tr> 
      <tr> 
       <td><a name="3"></a>3</td> 
       <td>Serious Error</td> 
       <td>Short error: Unsupported error level. <span class="longerr">Long error: The specified API error level is unsupported in this release.</span> </td> 
      </tr> 
      <tr> 
       <td><a name="5"></a>5</td> 
       <td>Serious Error</td> 
       <td>Short error: XML Parse error. <span class="longerr">Long error: XML Error Text: "<i>replaceable_value</i>".</span> </td> 
      </tr> 
      <tr> 
       <td><a name="9"></a>9</td> 
       <td>Serious Error</td> 
       <td>Short error: Integer value supplied for input "<i>replaceable_value</i>" is out of range. <span class="longerr">Long error: The integer you supplied is out of range. The valid range in the "tag name: minimum-maximum inclusive" format is "<i>replaceable_value</i>". Absence of minimum or maximum value indicates there is no minimum or maximum for this tag.</span> </td> 
      </tr>

       <td><a name="13"></a>13</td>
